class_notes:
(Same as THEA 230 2) - You must have permission to enroll in-person.
(1st year through 4th year students: THEA 230 is designed to develop a theoretical and practical understanding of the process involved in conceiving and executing a stage design and the interrelationship of the various design disciplines. Principles of Design serves as an introduction to the theory and practice of set design while touching on basic research in architecture and art history. In a broader sense, it is aimed to educate students on the motives behind design and structure of the world around us.)
(Course Fee: $50)
course_description: A theoretical and practical understanding of the process involved in conceiving and executing a stage design and the interrelationship of the various design disciplines.
